page.title: 17WHARF HOUSE,TWYFORD.
page.content: THE OWNER OF THE ABOVE TOLD US SOME OF HIS MEMORIES OF THE AREA. WHEN FIRST IN TWYFORD HE WORKED AT THE TWYFORD MILL,WHERE A WATER WHEEL WAS USED TO POWER A MILKING MACHINE. ORIGINALLY IT WAS USED FOR GRINDING CORN.HE SAID HE COULD DO AS MUCH IN A DAY WITH THE MILKING MACHINE AS 6 MEN COULD DO MANUALLY.HE REMEMBERS THE TIME WHEN HE COULD GRAZE THE COWS ON THE SIDE OF THE ROAD BECAUSE THE TRAFFIC WAS VERY LIGHT. WHARF HOUSE PREVIOSLY WAS THE RED LION PUBLIC HOUSE.WHEN TRADE FELL OFF THE BREWERY MOVED THE LICENCE IN THE EARLY 1950'S TO BODICOTE,BANBURY.THE BAR WAS TAKEN OUT AND CONVERTED TO LIVING ACCOMMODATION.THE OWNERS PROPERTY ALSO INCLUDES THE ATTACHED COTTAGE.
